rationale: This inscription is the epigraphic record of the quadruple alliance of 420 BC between Athens, Argos, Mantinea, and Elis, as described by Thucydides (5.47). It details the terms of mutual defense, the prohibition of separate peace treaties, the rules for military leadership (hegemony) during joint campaigns, and the specific financial compensation (pay) for different types of troops (hoplites, light-armed troops, archers, and cavalry) provided by the allies.
